revised_title: Anatomical Observations of Milk and Grass in Animal Veins and Wind-Pipes
tldr: The author discusses two curious observations: milk found in veins instead of blood and grass found in the wind-pipes of some animals. These findings were reported by two learned physicians, Dr. Clark and Dr. Lower, and raise questions about the mechanisms of animal nutrition and disease.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
